falstad

Class BasicRobotDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • falstad.BasicRobotDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RobotDriver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicRobotDriverTest, WallFollower, Wizard

    public abstract class BasicRobotDriver
extends java.lang.Object
implements RobotDriver
    Abstract RobotDriver implementing common features necessary for RobotDrivers. CRC: BasicRobotDriver (RobotDriver) Responsibilities Track energy used Track steps taken Provide instructions to robot so it attempts to navigate maze (abstract) Collaborators Robot to be controlled MazeController in which the robot operates; triggers start of driving when UI switches to play mode MazeApplication attaches driver to Robot and MazeController
    Author:
    Ben Zhang

    • Field Detail

      • ACTION_DELAY

        private static final int ACTION_DELAY
        Milliseconds to wait for actions (moves, turns) to complete. Set at 100 to match well with current GUI speeds. Set at zero to move as quickly as possible.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        protected Robot robot

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        protected void reset()
        Resets internal driver storage to original. Does not affect robot.

      • setRobot

        public void setRobot(Robot r)
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Assigns a robot platform to the driver. The driver uses a robot to perform, this method provides it with this necessary information.
        Specified by:
        setRobot in interface RobotDriver
        Parameters:
        r - robot to operate

      • setDimensions

        public void setDimensions(int width,
                          int height)
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Provides the robot driver with information on the dimensions of the 2D maze measured in the number of cells in each direction.
        Specified by:
        setDimensions in interface RobotDriver
        Parameters:
        width - of the maze
        height - of the maze

      • setDistance

        public void setDistance(generation.Distance distance)
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Provides the robot driver with information on the distance to the exit. Only some drivers such as the wizard rely on this information to find the exit.
        Specified by:
        setDistance in interface RobotDriver
        Parameters:
        distance - gives the length of path from current position to the exit.

      • driveStep

        protected boolean driveStep()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Provides a single step of progress for simple maze solving drivers. For dumb algorithms, driveStep can be overwritten rather than the whole of drive2Exit.
        Returns:
        true if progress continues; false if step determines that maze cannot be solved
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if robot halts during this step

      • drive2Exit

        public boolean drive2Exit()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Drives the robot towards the exit given it exists and given the robot's energy supply lasts long enough.
        Specified by:
        drive2Exit in interface RobotDriver
        Returns:
        true if driver successfully reaches the exit, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setupUsingMaze

        public void setupUsingMaze(falstad.MazeController controller)
        Allow for subclasses to have a custom setup for driving using data from a completed maze
        Parameters:
        controller - the maze controller to examine for setup

      • getCurrentRobotStatus

        protected generation.Wall getCurrentRobotStatus()
        Retrieve a wall object representing the current position and direction of the robot.
        Returns:
        Wall holding the position and direction of the robot

      • robotInPreviousState

        protected boolean robotInPreviousState()
        Check if the robot is currently in a state (position and direction) that is has reached in the past already. This is useful for dumb algorithms, revealing that they are going in loops and will never be able to solve the maze.
        Returns:
        true if robot has reached the current position and direction before; false otherwise.

      • registerRobotReached

        protected void registerRobotReached()
        Record that the robot reached a state (position and direction).

      • registerEnergyUsed

        protected void registerEnergyUsed(float energy)
        Records a usage of energy.
        Parameters:
        energy - the amount of energy used

      • registerMoveTaken

        protected void registerMoveTaken(int steps)
        Records that a move was taken.
        Parameters:
        number - of steps done in this move

      • registeredMove

        protected void registeredMove(int steps)
        Takes a move and records it and its energy use
        Parameters:
        steps - the number of steps forward to take

      • registeredTurn

        protected void registeredTurn(Robot.Turn turn)
        Takes a turn and records it and its energy use
        Parameters:
        turn - the turn to take

      • turnToFace

        protected void turnToFace(generation.CardinalDirection dir)
        Turns the robot the minimum amount needed (right or left) to end up facing in dir. If already facing that direction, does nothing.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction to face after turning

      • exitIfAble

        protected boolean exitIfAble()
        Complete (exit) the maze, if there is a straight line out from the robot's current position.
        Returns:
        true if robot exited the maze; false if failed to locate or reach an exit.

      • getEnergyConsumption

        public float getEnergyConsumption()
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Returns the total energy consumption of the journey, i.e., the difference between the robot's initial energy level at the starting position and its energy level at the exit position. This is used as a measure of efficiency for a robot driver.
        Specified by:
        getEnergyConsumption in interface RobotDriver

      • getPathLength

        public int getPathLength()
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Returns the total length of the journey in number of cells traversed. Being at the initial position counts as 0. This is used as a measure of efficiency for a robot driver.
        Specified by:
        getPathLength in interface RobotDriver
